intro: Silene borderei, commonly known as the border's campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats. The plant features showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Silene borderei is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found in open, sunny environments. It is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its native range.
